tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD1-002 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Safety and Environmental Support Activity, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: Mutual Exchange' (MX) is legal process available to social housing secure tenants, which entitles a tenant not in rent arrears and has a good tenancy record, to exchange their tenancy with another secure tenant, provided their housing needs match the intended property. Once an application is submitted, there is a statutory time limit of 42 days by which the landlord must make a decision and communicate it to the applicant.  The absence of a decision within 42 days entitles the applicant if so minded to go ahead and exchange the property.

tenders.title: Young Futures Panels Evaluation
tenders.summary: Summary:  We are looking to appoint an evaluation partner to review and support the Young Futures Panels Evaluation.   Specific Research Questions will include:   How, and to what extent, are the Youn
tenders.detailedDescription: Summary:  We are looking to appoint an evaluation partner to review and support the Young Futures Panels Evaluation.   Specific Research Questions will include:   How, and to what extent, are the Young Futures Panels (YFP) continuing to meet their objectives?    How have the Young Futures Panels been implemented across different areas of West Yorkshire and what are the key enablers and barriers to effective delivery?   How has the learning from the pilot stage been used to shape and refine YFP implementation and what are the advantages and disadvantages of this in West Yorkshire?    The proposed evaluation objectives include:   Examine the continued delivery of the YFP identifying areas of good practice and opportunities for further improvement and adaption.   Review each areas' theory of change to ensure they reflect current delivery.    Review all processes involved in the delivery of the YFP in each area, offering partners constructive recommendations for efficiency and supporting them to embed delivery as part of business as usual.   Examine the onward referral processes into local services, identify areas of improvement and support Panel members to implement recommendations.    Ensure that the perceptions of both young people in receipt of Panel support and professionals involved in the Panels are captured sufficiently to identify feedback loops and further ideas on improvement while gauging their general response to the process.    Support Panel members and the VRP to continually improve monitoring materials to support effective performance monitoring and impact evaluations.    Pilot and review how an impact evaluation could best be designed to capture the impact of Panels on intended outcomes and any other potential outcomes.    Provide detailed recommendations and an evaluation framework for the optimal design of an impact evaluation.   Develop implementation guidance to support the onboarding of other areas to develop and implement a YFP.

tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Logistics, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: 704399451-108 - MSS/142 MRO119_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Electrical, Power and Distribution items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of 317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.
